result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlin Lee Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orlin Lee Webster is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orlin Lee Webster was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:58 PM. State - resolved - defendant will plead to count #1 as alleged, #2 - dismissed, $500 fine plus costs - have complied with victim notification requirements. Webster and Voorhees agree but have to complete the plea questionnaire. Recess to fill out plea questionnaire (2:00 PM). Recalled at 4:08 PM with same appearances. Court now has plea questionnaire. State - plead to count #1 as alleged, dismiss #2, have complied with victim notification with no response, $500 fine plus costs as a joint recommendation. Webster and Voorhees agree. Court dismisses count #2. Webster plead G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Voorhees - follow joint recommendation. Webster makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $500.00 fine plus costs totalling $1083.00 - paid at rate of $100.00/month commencing 6/15/16/CO, submit DNA.
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster - who appears telephonically with leave of the Court and his attorney John E Voorhees appears in person.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:57 AM. State files an Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas, continues bond, set for FPT. Voorhees will get a date from JA for motion hearing if needed or can hear the motion on that same date and time.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:40 PM. State's  - here for a continuance of a PH. State calls Brooke Sanapaw. Sanapaw sworn in at 1:42 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Voorhees objects - sustained. State offers exhibit #1 - statement of witness. State moves for the admission of exhibit #1. Voorhees makes statement. Court receives exhibit #1. Voorhees objects - sustained.  Cross exam by Voorhees at 1:52 PM. Court asks question of witness (1:57 PM). State re-directs at 1:59 PM. Re-cross by Voorhees at 2:02 PM. Sanapaw excused at 2:04 PM. State makes argument - only need for Ms. Sanapaw today was for identification of the defendant - asks for bind over. Voorhees makes argument - moves for dismissal of count #2 for stated reasons and to make appropriate findings that only a misd occurred. State responds briefly. Voorhees reponds briefly. Court makes ruling after reviewing statutes - finds probable cause that a felony was committed and sets matter for ARGN. Court continues bond. Court quashes warrant on Brooke Sanapaw.  Arraignment scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 10:30 am. Court has no objections to the defendant appearing telephonically at ARGN.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
BODY ONLY - Material Witness - Brooke Sanapaw
Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 12:01 AM. State here for continuation of PH, now has proof of service on Sanapaw and witness does not appear, indicated to his office that she did not intend to show up today. Voorhees leaves situation to the courts discression. Court issues a material witness warrant, hold for appearance, body only. Voorhees asks for PH date, so that she could appear voluntairly on that date. Court sets PH date and instructs DA & Voorhees that if they get any inclination that she will not appear on the 24th date, change the PH to STC and defendant and Voorhees could then appear telephonically.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
sub service on TW for BS
Email from Process Server - indicating Sanapaw was sub served but no proof yet.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:29 PM. Also called 16CF14. State calls Deputy Jason Novak. Voorhees asks for sequestration of witnesses. Court grants sequestration. Novak sworn in at 1:20 PM. Direct exam by State. Voorhees objects - overruled (1:21 PM). Cross exam by Voorhees at 1:26 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (1:28 PM). State asks if file has a proof of service for witness Sanapaaw, asks for an adjournment. Voorhees leaves the decision up to the Court. Court will allow an adjourment of the PH after no objections stated by Voorhees. Court continues bond on this matter and sets for an adjourned PH. Court moves on to PH for 16CF14.  State calls Detective Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 1:34 PM. Direct exam by State. Voorhees objects - hearsay - overruled but noted on the record. Discussion on hearsay again, overruled, record made by Voorhees. State continues with direct exam (1:41 PM). Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:48 PM). Cross exam by Voorhees at 1:49 PM. State objects - sustained (1:49 PM). State objects - overruled (1:52 PM). State objects - sustained (1:53 PM). State objects to line of questioning - discovery in nature - sustained (1:53 PM). State objects - sustained (1:55 PM). Court finds probable cause on this matter that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information and wants a recess to discuss it with the defendant. Recess at 1:56 PM. Back on record at 2:06 PM with same appearances. Voorhees renews request for a continuance of ARGN for stated reasons. Recess to file request for substitution. Recalled at 2:10 PM. Voorhees files written request for substitution. Court continues bond and will accept RFS as timely.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:45 am.
No contact with minor victim (UCS) and no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster appears via video from FC jail, in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF13 & 16CF14. Here for INIT appearances. Defendant has received a copies of both complaints. Court reads charges & penalties. Webster understands charges on both complaints. Voorhees waives further reading. State asks for a $1000 cash total for both cases, no contact with minor victim (UCS). Voorhees asks for signature bond. Court imposes $2500 signature bond in 16CF13 with conditions of no contact with minor victim(UCS) and no consumption of alcohol and $500 cash bond in 16CF14 with conditions of no contact with minor victim (UCS) and no consumption of alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
